Any other more comforting?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Any other more comforting?
By Sensit on Thursday, February 21, 2002 - 03:23 pm:

When my monster (hare) died, it was horrible and torturous. A question that might not be so great of help is: Is there any monster that dies without looking like he's feeling the worst thing in the world?

By Anonymous on Thursday, February 21, 2002 - 04:07 pm:

BTW, NEVER let a Karakarakkung (Ducken/Takrama) die. It spits out a "skull" and it's eyes roll out of it's skull.....

By torey_luvullo on Friday, February 22, 2002 - 07:02 am:

the deaths are so melodramatic. what makes them even more entertaining is fleria's one tenth of a second of mourning before she cheers up and says "off to the shrine to get another!"

By Lightning Tiger on Saturday, March 23, 2002 - 07:48 am:

Yeah, I agree with torey. I mean in MR2 Colt cried much more and you could have a funeral, and to tell you the truth I liked the music more, too. In MR3 Fleria acts like nothing happened(well almost, she cries for like a second and then says something like what torey said)and BTW it seems she was HAPPY the monster died. OK, so not really, but she should have more respect.

By Zidane on Saturday, March 23, 2002 - 09:03 am:

By Khift on Saturday, March 23, 2002 - 09:38 am:

Well, you DO get a heart when your monster dies, and your old monsters don't get too much stats, so it is a little bit real if you were happy your monster dies, but in MR2 you lost a very important part of raising. You can't combine a dead monster, you see? Gameplaywise, it is fully realistic.

By Khift on Saturday, March 23, 2002 - 09:40 am:

And if you like Fantasy novels, the death of a Durahan is _VERY_ saddening. He thrusts his sword up into the air one final time like he was the last man left on the battlefield, before collapsing onto the blood stained earth...

Oops, sorry there. Got carried away.

By COWS_R_COOL on Wednesday, May 1, 2002 - 06:31 pm:

By Nicole on Wednesday, July 28, 2004 - 09:32 am:

In MR2, dying was just going to sleep and never waking up. I was sad when my Gaboo, named Gaboo, died, I cried just a bit but I was happy to see his spirit going up to the big monster ranch in the sky. My Metanix in MR3, R2D2, was like Gaboo. He was sooooooo strong, but I liked him for who he was, not because he made one-hit victories. When he died, (He was my only MR3 monster to have died) I gave his heart to a new Metanix, R2D2 Jr., who got to rank B faster than R2D2. R2D2's death didn't look too bad, but I don't recall exactly what happened.

By Shadowscythe1234 on Sunday, October 9, 2005 - 11:38 am:

Zan dies quite peacefully. it just looks tired sits on the ground looks up at the stars then lays down and its soul goes to monster heaven

By Azulazulazula on Sunday, March 31, 2013 - 12:10 pm:

I just want to throw in my eleven-year late two cents, Fleria actually IS happy when the monsters die! She's all, "It's sad we won't see him anymore, but instead of letting him rest in peace, we'll keep brooding on it and get a new monster!" And then she does this giddy little smile thing. Of all the things I like about MR3, I can't stand Fleria. At all.

Rant. Over.
